reference.title: PMU events
reference.shortdesc: The following table shows the events that are generated and the numbers that the PMU uses to reference the events. The table also shows the bit position of each event on the event bus. Event reference numbers that are not listed are reserved.

row.entry: Software increment. Instruction architecturally executed (condition code check pass).

entry.p: L1 instruction cache refill. This event counts any instruction fetch which misses in the cache.
The following instructions are not counted:
L1 instruction refill. This event counts any refill of the instruction L1 from the L2 . This includes refills that result in a translation fault.
The following instructions are not counted:
This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.
L1 data cache refill. This event counts any load or store operation or page table walk access which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1.
The following instructions are not counted:

ul.li: Stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1.
Partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache.

entry.p: This event counts the sum of L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD and L1D_CACHE_REFILL_WR.

L1 data cache access. This event counts any load or store operation or walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL event causes this event to count.
The following instructions are not counted:
This event counts the sum of L1D_CACHE_RD and L1D_CACHE_WR.
L1 data refill. This event counts any refill of the data L1 from the L2 . This includes refills that result in a translation . The following instructions are not counted:
This event counts regardless of whether the is enabled.
Instruction architecturally executed. This event counts all retired instructions, including those that fail their condition check.

row.entry: Instruction architecturally executed, pass, exception return.

entry.p: Instruction architecturally executed, pass, write to CONTEXTIDR. This event only counts writes to CONTEXTIDR in AArch32 state, and via the CONTEXTIDR_EL1 mnemonic in AArch64 state.
The following instructions are not counted:

Mispredicted or not predicted branch speculatively executed. This event counts any predictable branch instruction which is mispredicted either due to dynamic misprediction or because the is off and the branches are statically predicted not taken.
Predictable branch speculatively executed. This event counts all predictable branches.

row.entry:
Data memory access. This event counts memory accesses due to load or store instructions.
The following instructions are not counted:
Instruction fetches.
Cache maintenance instructions.
Translation table walks or prefetches. This event counts the sum of MEM_ACCESS_RD and MEM_ACCESS_WR.

Level 1 instruction cache access or Level 0 Macro-op cache access. This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the L1 instruction cache or L0 Macro-op cache.The following instructions are not counted:
Cache maintenance instructions.
Non- accesses.

entry.p: L1 data cache -Back. This event counts any write-back of data from the L1 data cache to L2 or L3. This counts both victim line evictions and snoops, including cache maintenance operations.
The following instructions are not counted:

ul.li: Invalidations which do not result in data being transferred out of the L1.
Full-line writes which write to L2 without writing L1, such as write streaming mode.

entry.p: L2 data cache access. This event counts any transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache, and any from the L1 to the L2. Snoops from outside the core and cache maintenance operations are not counted.
L2 data cache refill. This event counts any transaction from L1 which causes data to be from outside the . L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted.

L2 data cache . This event counts any of data from the L2 cache to outside the . This includes snoops to the L2 which return data, regardless of whether they cause an invalidation. Invalidations from the L2 which do not write data outside of the and snoops which return data from the L1 are not counted.

Bus access. This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the data channels between the and the SCU. If both and write data beats are transferred on a given cycle, this event is counted twice on that cycle. This event counts the sum of BUS_ACCESS_RD and BUS_ACCESS_WR.
Local memory error. This event counts any correctable or uncorrectable memory error (ECC or parity) in the protected RAMs.
Instruction architecturally executed, pass, write to TTBR.This event only counts writes to TTBR0/TTBR1 in state and TTBR0_EL1/TTBR1_EL1 in state.
The following instructions are not counted:
Bus cycles. This event duplicates CPU_CYCLES.
For odd-numbered counters, increments the count by one for each overflow of the preceding even-numbered counter. For even-numbered counters, there is no increment.

L2 data cache allocation without refill. This event counts any full cache line write into the L2 cache which does not cause a linefill, including s from L1 to L2 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L1.
Instruction architecturally executed, branch. This event counts all branches, taken or not. This excludes entries, debug entries and CCFAIL branches.
Instruction architecturally executed, mispredicted branch. This event counts any branch counted by BR_RETIRED which is not correctly predicted and causes a pipeline flush.
No operation issued because of the frontend. The counter counts on any cycle when there are no fetched instructions available to dispatch.
No operation issued because of the backend. The counter counts on any cycle fetched instructions are not dispatched due to resource constraints.

Level 1 data access. This event counts any load or store operation which accesses the data L1 . If both a load and a store are executed on a cycle, this event counts twice. This event counts regardless of whether the is enabled.
Level 1 instruction access. This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the instruction L1 .This event counts regardless of whether the is enabled.

row.entry: Attributable L3 data or unified cache allocation without refill. This event counts any full cache line write into the L3 cache which does not cause a linefill, including s from L2 to L3 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L2.

entry.p: Attributable Level 3 unified cache refill.

This event counts for any transaction returning data from the SCU for which the data source was outside the cluster. Transactions such as ReadUnique are counted here as '' transactions, even though they can be generated by store instructions.
Attributable Level 3 unified cache access.
This event counts for any transaction returning data from the SCU, or for any write to the SCU.
Attributable L2 data or unified refill. This event counts on any refill of the L2 , caused by either an instruction or data access. This event does not count if the is disabled.
Attributable L2 data or unified access. This event counts on any access to the L2 (caused by a refill of any of the L1 s). This event does not count if the is disabled.

row.entry: Access to another socket in a multi-socket system.

entry.p: Access to data that caused a walk. This event counts on any data access which causes L2D__REFILL to count.
Access to instruction that caused a walk. This event counts on any instruction access which causes L2D__REFILL to count.
Last level cache access, .

ul.li: If CPUECTLR.EXTLLC is set: This event counts any transaction which returns a data source of 'interconnect cache'.

If CPUECTLR.EXTLLC is not set: This event is a duplicate of the L*D_CACHE_RD event corresponding to the last level of cache implemented – L3D_CACHE_RD if both per- L2 and L3 are implemented, L2D_CACHE_RD if only one is implemented, or L1D_CACHE_RD if neither is implemented.

entry.p: Last level cache miss, .

ul.li: If CPUECTLR.EXTLLC is set: This event counts any transaction which returns a data source of 'DRAM', 'remote' or 'inter- peer'.

li.p: If CPUECTLR.EXTLLC is not set: This event is a duplicate of the L*D_CACHE_REFILL_RD event corresponding to the last level of cache implemented – L3D_CACHE_REFILL_RD if both per- L2 and L3 are implemented, L2D_CACHE_REFILL_RD if only one is implemented, or L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD if neither is implemented.

entry.p: L1 data cache access, . This event counts any load operation or walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD event causes this event to count.
The following instructions are not counted:

L1 data cache access, write. This event counts any store operation which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL_WR event causes this event to count.
The following instructions are not counted:
L1 data cache refill, . This event counts any load operation or walk access which causes data to be from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1.
The following instructions are not counted:
L1 data cache refill, write. This event counts any store operation which causes data to be from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1.
The following instructions are not counted:

li.p: Stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1.

ul.li: Partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache.

entry.p: L1 data cache refill, inner. This event counts any L1 D-cache linefill (as counted by L1D_CACHE_REFILL) which hits in the L2 cache, L3 cache or another in the .

L1 data cache refill, outer. This event counts any L1 D-cache linefill (as counted by L1D_CACHE_REFILL) which does not hit in the L2 cache, L3 cache or another in the , and instead obtains data from outside the .

row.entry: L1 data cache cleaning and coherency

entry.p: L2 data cache access, . This event counts any transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache.
Snoops from outside the are not counted.
L2 data cache access, write. This event counts any write transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache or any from L1 which allocates into the L2 cache.
Snoops from outside the are not counted.

L2 data cache refill, . This event counts any transaction from L1 which causes data to be from outside the . L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted. Transactions such as ReadUnique are counted here as '' transactions, even though they can be generated by store instructions.

L2 data cache refill, write. This event counts any write transaction from L1 which causes data to be from outside the . L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted. Transactions such as ReadUnique are not counted as write transactions.

row.entry: L2 data cache , ing and coherency.
L2 data or unified refill, write.
L2 data or unified access, write.

entry.p: Bus access . This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the data channel between the and the SCU.
Bus access write. This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the write data channel between the and the SCU.
Data memory access, . This event counts memory accesses due to load instructions. The following instructions are not counted:
• Instruction fetches.
• Cache maintenance instructions.
• Translation table walks.
• Prefetches.

row.entry:
Data memory access, write. This event counts memory accesses due to store instructions.The following instructions are not counted:
• Instruction fetches.
• Cache maintenance instructions.
• Translation table walks.
• Prefetches.
Exclusive operation speculatively executed, LDREX or LDX.
Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX or STX pass.
Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX or STX fail.
Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX or STX.

entry.p: Operation speculatively executed, load or store. This event counts the sum of LD_SPEC and ST_SPEC.

row.entry: Operation speculatively executed, Advanced SIMD instruction.
Operation speculatively executed, software change of the PC.
Counts the number of undefined s taken locally.
Exception taken locally, Data Abort and SError.
Exception taken locally, Secure Monitor Call.
Exception taken, or SError not taken locally.
Exception taken, Other traps not taken locally.
Release consistency operation speculatively executed, load-acquire.
Release consistency operation speculatively executed, store-release.
